results.title: Effects of Candesartan vs Lisinopril on Neurocognitive Function in Older Adults With Executive Mild Cognitive Impairment
results.text_hl: Effects of @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@Candesartan@@@ vs @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@Lisinopril@@@ on Neurocognitive Function in Older Adults With Executive Mild @<m>DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@Cognitive Impairment@@@

citations.NLM: Hajjar I, Okafor M, McDaniel D, Obideen M, Dee E, Shokouhi M, Quyyumi AA, Levey A, Goldstein F. Effects of Candesartan vs Lisinopril on Neurocognitive Function in Older Adults With Executive Mild Cognitive Impairment JAMA Netw Open. 2020 Aug 3;3(8):e2012252. PMID: 32761160

results.title: Differential Sex-Specific Effects of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibition and Angiotensin Receptor Blocker Therapy on Arterial Function in Hypertension: CALIBREX Trial.
results.text_hl: METHODS: In 141 @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ participants with mild @<m>DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive impairment@@@ (age 65.9+-7.7, 57% female), @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@candesartan@@@ (up to 32 mg, n=77) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ (up to 40 mg, n=64) were administered to achieve blood @DISEASE_Pressure_Ulcer @DISEASE_MESH:D003668 @@@pressure@@@ <140/90 mm Hg.

citations.NLM: Rogers SC, Ko YA, Quyyumi AA, Hajjar I. Differential Sex-Specific Effects of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibition and Angiotensin Receptor Blocker Therapy on Arterial Function in Hypertension: CALIBREX Trial. Hypertension. 2022 Oct;79(10):2316-2327. PMID: 35916128
citations.BibTeX: @article{35916128, title={Differential Sex-Specific Effects of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme Inhibition and Angiotensin Receptor Blocker Therapy on Arterial Function in Hypertension: CALIBREX Trial.}, author={Rogers SC and Ko YA and Quyyumi AA and Hajjar I}, journal={Hypertension}, volume={79}, number={10}, pages={2316-2327}}

results.title: Psychological Continuum of Elderly Patients Suffering from Arterial Hypertension with Metabolic Syndrome, Against the Background of Chronotherapy with a Fixed Combination of Amlodipine, Lisinopril and Rosuvastatin.

results.title: The rationale and design of the antihypertensives and vascular, endothelial, and cognitive function (AVEC) trial in elderly hypertensives with early cognitive impairment: Role of the renin angiotensin system inhibition
results.text_hl: A total of 100 community eligible individuals (60 years or older) with @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and early @<m>DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive impairment@@@ are being recruited from the greater Boston area and randomized to @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@, @CHEMICAL_candesartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:C081643 @@@candesartan@@@, or @CHEMICAL_Hydrochlorothiazide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006852 @@@hydrochlorothiazide@@@ ("active control") for 12 months.

citations.NLM: Hajjar I, Hart M, Milberg W, Novak V, Lipsitz L. The rationale and design of the antihypertensives and vascular, endothelial, and cognitive function (AVEC) trial in elderly hypertensives with early cognitive impairment: Role of the renin angiotensin system inhibition BMC Geriatr. 2009 Nov 18;9():48. PMID: 19922631

results.title: [Impact of antihypertensive therapy on clinical status and quality of life in patients with initial manifestations of hypertensive encephalopathy].
results.text_hl: All the @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ were observed to have @<m>DISEASE_Cognition_Disorders</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D003072 @@@cognitive dysfunctions@@@.
